channel.title: Reading the Source
channel.description:
Well, after all your help in my previous thread, I was able to uncompress the runescape.jar, and decompile the classes finally joining them all in NetBeans. I've got NO IDEA how you guys get to understand ANYTHING from that! I even tried downloading a deob version, but's the same sea of names, and methods leading to other classes which call a method that changes the value of a "random" variable.
Am I missing something? I read one could try debugging, but then I have several obstacles. I couldn't find any free bytecode debugger. In order to debug the source code I need a deob version of it. If I used a deob version it'll probably be old for I won't be able to connect or do anything.
Please, tell me I'm missing something huge, otherwise I really admire your level of interpreation and would appreciate if you could share your wisdom... lol

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

lol right thanks=)

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ShKz:

so when coding, //=/?

No, those are forward slashes, and these are back slashes. What you meant was \=\

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

the \s is a whitespace char, but because its in a string in the source, you need to escape the , hence \s

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Okay… then what about the ‘s’? unless it’s ment to be ‘\s’

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:19, topic:373750”]

Thanks guys =p
I’ll continue by trying to learn to parse the parameters.

EDIT: Ok, i read freddy’s tutorial on how to parse the params, and it’s suprisingly easy to understand! My only problem is that I dont understand the pattern searching string he used: "<param name=([^\\s]+)\\s+value=([^>]*)>"
I know that [^abc] means anything but abc, and that \s is a space character, but then there are two slashes so I’m a little confused :p[/quote]Double slashes is escape characters.

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Thanks guys =p
I’ll continue by trying to learn to parse the parameters.

EDIT: Ok, i read freddy’s tutorial on how to parse the params, and it’s suprisingly easy to understand! My only problem is that I dont understand the pattern searching string he used: "<param name=([^\\s]+)\\s+value=([^>]*)>"
I know that [^abc] means anything but abc, and that \s is a space character, but then there are two slashes so I’m a little confused

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

ShKz:

And could it be that signed runs faster? I think I read that somewhere over here… Now, could someon instead of using a loader, upload the jar to a host, without having to parse the parameters or something like that which I heard needs to be done in order to “pretend” you’re in a browser?

You need a loader to “start” the game.

Or you’re talking about the loader.jar (which as previously mentioned loads the game in signed mode) then I’m not sure.

I think you need to rework your understandings and maybe write a loader…

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Signed starts faster, once you’ve already run it, because it can load the cached stuff from disk, whereas unsigned has to regrab it every time because it’s not allowed to do disk IO.

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

And could it be that signed runs faster? I think I read that somewhere over here… Now, could someon instead of using a loader, upload the jar to a host, without having to parse the parameters or something like that which I heard needs to be done in order to “pretend” you’re in a browser?

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:10, topic:373750”]Thanks for the replies!

Let me see if I understand… The loader, is signed meaning it has the privileges to read and write, while the runescape.jar doesnt… So the loader somehow gives the runescape.jar privileges to read and write??? Sounds awkward, why would the do it that way?[/quote]
The “loader” can also load an unsigned client, which is easier/less code.

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:373750”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=469752.msg3435410#msg3435410 date=1292719829]

[img ]http://www.gamertagpics.com/users/a/As/AshleySmashleyy/okay_meme_tf2_version_by_jaymewes-d2y3ud5(2).jpg[ /img]

okay…
Anyway thanks for replying =) And kind to begin with something, why is there a need to use a loader?
[/quote]The loader is used to run the signed instance of the game applet. Basically the runescape jar, by default, contains the unsigned classes (where the cache is loaded completely on demand and nothing is stored on disk) and the loader contains five classes that would change the applet’s functionality to run signed. So all it really does is replace the “unsigned classes” with the “signed classes” and voila – the applet now stores the cache onto disk, loads it from there and does a shitload of invasive crap (GetActiveWindow and the retrieval of clipboard content specifically comes to mind).

Where do they get the active window? And when did they start doing that?[/quote]it’s been there since the implementation of native libraries (early 540s?)

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

edit: apparently it’s just used in _CRT_INIT

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:5, topic:373750”][quote author=ShKz link=topic=469752.msg3434867#msg3434867 date=1292687088]
[img ]http://www.gamertagpics.com/users/a/As/AshleySmashleyy/okay_meme_tf2_version_by_jaymewes-d2y3ud5(2).jpg[ /img]

okay…
Anyway thanks for replying =) And kind to begin with something, why is there a need to use a loader?
[/quote]The loader is used to run the signed instance of the game applet. Basically the runescape jar, by default, contains the unsigned classes (where the cache is loaded completely on demand and nothing is stored on disk) and the loader contains five classes that would change the applet’s functionality to run signed. So all it really does is replace the “unsigned classes” with the “signed classes” and voila – the applet now stores the cache onto disk, loads it from there and does a shitload of invasive crap (GetActiveWindow and the retrieval of clipboard content specifically comes to mind).[/quote]

Where do they get the active window? And when did they start doing that?

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Thanks for the replies!

Let me see if I understand… The loader, is signed meaning it has the privileges to read and write, while the runescape.jar doesnt… So the loader somehow gives the runescape.jar privileges to read and write??? Sounds awkward, why would the do it that way?

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

eczema3:

Surely there has to be privacy rules which disallow them from looking at the contents of your clipboard without specifically telling you they’re gonna do it?

You have to use an unsigned client if you want to disallow them looking at clipboard and various other things. I dont see why they would have to tell you? They would just not be allowed to use it as evidence.

Read full topic

Surely there has to be privacy rules which disallow them from looking at the contents of your clipboard without specifically telling you they’re gonna do it?

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:4, topic:373750”][img]http://www.gamertagpics.com/users/a/As/AshleySmashleyy/okay_meme_tf2_version_by_jaymewes-d2y3ud5(2).jpg[ /img]

okay…
Anyway thanks for replying =) And kind to begin with something, why is there a need to use a loader?[/quote]The loader is used to run the signed instance of the game applet. Basically the runescape jar, by default, contains the unsigned classes (where the cache is loaded completely on demand and nothing is stored on disk) and the loader contains five classes that would change the applet’s functionality to run signed. So all it really does is replace the “unsigned classes” with the “signed classes” and voila – the applet now stores the cache onto disk, loads it from there and does a shitload of invasive crap (GetActiveWindow and the retrieval of clipboard content specifically comes to mind).

Read full topic

item.title: Reading the Source
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

First, think of something specific you are looking for. Then, if you can’t think of any way to find it, post here and maybe someone will give you a hint.

Yes, most people do reverse it by looking at that shit. No, it’s not ideal.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Well, after all your help in my previous thread, I was able to uncompress the runescape.jar, and decompile the classes finally joining them all in NetBeans. I’ve got NO IDEA how you guys get to understand ANYTHING from that! I even tried downloading a deob version, but’s the same sea of names, and methods leading to other classes which call a method that changes the value of a “random” variable.

Am I missing something? I read one could try debugging, but then I have several obstacles.
I couldn’t find any free bytecode debugger.
In order to debug the source code I need a deob version of it.
If I used a deob version it’ll probably be old for I won’t be able to connect or do anything.

Please, tell me I’m missing something huge, otherwise I really admire your level of interpreation and would appreciate if you could share your wisdom… lol
